column4: Hi. When i try to drag files from file roller and try to drop them on the desktop or in a folder, nothing happens. What's wrong?
so there is no drag-and-drop support in file roller?
are you using the winehq repo? instructions on the link i gave you
no, im not even using ubuntu, i didnt need help btw
those links say nothing about encoding video.
not sure exactly, there are a few video editing programs out there, but im not really sure what theyre called, sorry for the bad factoid, i figured it would get you started at least
i am trying to encode mpeg-4 files with ffmpeg, but somehow ubuntu removed the AAC support in it. so now i cannot convert videos to watch with my smartphone.
sudo apt-get install faac     maybe help you?
tried it, didn't help. ffmpeg says aac is a "unsupported format" even when the man page says ffmpeg supports aac
if i remember correctly, ffmpeg has to be compiled with aac support, apparently the ubuntu package of it wasnt compiled in such a fashion
that sux. should i contact the package maintainer?
have you added the medibuntu repositories? its possible the ffmpeg package in there has aac support
nice idea. thx, i'll try it
adding the medibuntu repo upgraded ffmpeg to a version that supports mpeg4. thank you! I'm glad there are no software patents in Europe.
